message:
Hi, Stephen!
You noted in your article https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/archive/msdn-magazine/2011/february/msdn-magazine-parallel-computing-it-s-all-about-the-synchronizationcontext that: «Finally, the SynchronizationContext.Post method isn’t necessarily asynchronous. Most implementations do implement it asynchronously, but AspNetSynchronizationContext is a notable exception. This may cause unexpected re-entrancy issues.»
But what are these issues? Can you give us some examples?
